column4: I think you can only run one gdm so run a 2nd window manager instead

I am an Ubuntu-newbie and so don't know how to do that. What I am trying to do is to run a game in fullscreen on one screen while having my usual desktop open on another screen, so I can switch back and forth between botht
is you display adapter dual display capable, or are you using a laptop and external screen ?
I am only using a tower with a motherboard with an nvidia-chipset (geForce 8300).
no second display connected, if that was part of your question
I thought you said a game on 1 screen and regular desktop on another ... is that not 2 screens ?
I meant "two virtual screens"
ahh ... so more than 1 desktop
between which I can switch back and forth with ctrl+alt+fn
well, yes
yes, what I need (probably) are two desktops at the same time.
will they be the same or different resolution ?
They can be the same, no problem with that
so just use gnome virtual desktops
I will google for that, thank you
do you have the workspace switcher icon on a panel anywhere ?
if not, right click on a panel and select "add to panel" and choose "workspace switcher"
yep, it is in the lower right corner
ok, so there's probably 4 virtual desktops ... click on one of them and launch the game...
thanks, I will try that
sorry, but your solution doesn't work. If I run the game in fullscreen I can't switch between the workspaces. I guess I really need two virtual screens
you still here ?
